newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil ends listless day steady, Brent drops.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil ends listless day steady, Brent drops.

text.p: IPE April gas oil closed on Wednesday unchanged on the day after low volume trading in a $2 range.
The prompt April contract closed steady at $165.50 a tonne and the May was also unchanged on the day at $167.50. Further forward contracts lost between 25 cents and $1.25 a tonne.

"It's been deadly quiet and there is really nothing to say. Gas oil is suffering because the arbitrage (against NYMEX) is only open for about one and a half hours so the volume is very slack," one analyst said.
Europe has moved over to summer time a week ahead of the U.S. and so the NYMEX markets open at 1545 British time and close an hour after the IPE.

Meanwhile, May Brent crude oil lost some 19 cents to trade at $18.92 a barrel by 1640 GMT. Most brokers expected the contract to break below support at $18.83 a barrel and some expected current weak fundamentals to pull crude down by another dollar in the medium term.
"We may have another leg down and it would not surprise me if (crude) prices came off another dollar when you look at fundamentals," one broker said.
A fundamentally weak market has led to trade such as the Brent deal seen done on Wednesday at a 97-cent discount to May Brent in the cash market.
